parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  The content focuses on energy projects and their long-term impact, not on any particular candidate or party's platform.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content addresses general societal concerns about energy investments and their impact on future generations.  The reach estimate (100K-500K) further supports this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is not to influence votes in the parliamentary elections. The content focuses on a discussion of energy policy and its long-term consequences, a topic relevant to the public but not directly tied to swaying votes for or against any specific candidate or party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of citizen journalism or opinion piece, presenting a viewpoint on a matter of public interest. It provides a link to a longer article on the same topic, suggesting a commitment to providing information rather than solely promoting a candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the post expresses an opinion on the importance of long-term energy investments, it does not present a personal opinion unrelated to the electoral process. The opinion is presented within the context of a public policy discussion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1128410958768393</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while politically themed, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post does not explicitly endorse or oppose any candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections. The content focuses on a general discussion of energy policy and its long-term effects, a topic of public interest but not directly related to influencing electoral choices. The post's objective appears to be to inform and raise awareness about energy-related issues, not to promote a specific candidate or party.  The presence of a link to a longer article further suggests an intent to provide information rather than solely engage in electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Eoficial.ro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
